content.text:
# 2024 Outer Critics Circle Awards

| venue = New York Public Library for the Performing Arts
}}
The 2024 Outer Critics Circle Awards winners were announced on May 13, 2024, recognizing excellence in Broadway and Off-Broadway productions during the 2023–24 season. Nominations were announced on April 23, 2024, with Dead Outlaw receiving the most nominations with nine. The Connector and Stereophonic followed with seven nominations.
Stereophonic was the biggest winner of the night, taking home four awards, including Outstanding New Broadway Play, Outstanding Scenic Design, Outstanding Sound Design, and Outstanding Director of a Play for Daniel Aukin. Close behind, Suffs won Best Broadway Musical, Dead Outlaw earned Outstanding Off-Broadway Musical, and Primary Trust received Outstanding Off-Broadway Play—each with three wins.
Winners and nominees
The 2023-2024 Outer Critics Circle Awards nominations were announced on Friday, April 23, 2024, by Merrily We Roll Along cast members Jonathan Groff, Daniel Radcliffe and Lindsay Mendez.
The 2024 Outer Critics Circle Awards winners were announced on May 13, 2024, with Stereophonic leading the winners by taking home four awards, including Outstanding New Broadway Play. Entering with 9 nominations, Dead Outlaw took home three awards, along with Suffs and Primary Trust. Revival awards went to Appropriate for play and I Can Get It For You Wholesale for musical revival.
Due to its Broadway timeline, the Park Avenue Armory run of Illinoise was considered in off-Broadway categories, where applicable, while the Broadway production of Suffs was determined to at least 50% different than its original off-Broadway iteration. Therefore, it was deemed eligible in all production categories and select acting categories.
